description: Barack Obama was born on August 4, 1961, at Kapi ªolani Medical Center for Women & Children in Honolulu, Hawaii.
Obama lived in Jakarta, Indonesia, from 1967 to 1971 with his mother and stepfather. He attended local schools during this time.
After returning to Honolulu in 1971, Obama finished high school at Punahou School. He spent his teenage years in Hawaii.
Obama attended Occidental College in Los Angeles from 1979 to 1981 before transferring to Columbia University in New York City.
In New York City, Obama attended Columbia University and graduated in 1983 with a degree in political science.
Obama worked as a community organizer in Chicago from 1985 to 1988, focusing on issues of poverty and unemployment in the city.
Obama attended Harvard Law School in Cambridge, Massachusetts, where he was the first black president of the Harvard Law Review.
Returning to Chicago, Obama taught constitutional law at the University of Chicago and worked as a civil rights attorney and a lecturer.
Obama served as a U.S. Senator from Illinois before becoming the 44th President of the United States, with his inauguration in Washington, D.C., in 2009.
During his presidency, Barack Obama resided in the White House in Washington, D.C., from 2009 to 2017.
